required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Next-Gen MS: Feed-forward PRO Data for MS Research
clinical_study.official_title: Next-Gen MS: A Prospective, Cluster-randomized Study Evaluating the Impact of "Feed-forward" Patient Reported Outcomes Data to Clinical Teams Managing Adults Living With MS in a Learning Health System for MS Research

lead_sponsor.agency: EMD Serono Research & Development Institute, Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: This Next Generation learning health system for Multiple Sclerosis (Next-Gen MS) study is a sub-study of the MS-LINKâ„¢ Outcomes Study (NCT04735406). The study aims to examine the effects of using feed forward Patient Reported Outcomes (PROs) data in real-world Multiple Sclerosis (MS) care settings. The study will be conducted within an emerging Learning Healthcare System (LHS).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Health-Related Quality of Life 14 Item (HR-QoL-14)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with >=1-point Increase from Baseline in Patient Determined Disease Steps (PDDS) Sustained Via Consecutive Measures Over 3 Months

arm_group.description: Participants in this group will participate in monthly learning collaborative webinars. Feed-forward of patient reported outcomes (PRO) data collected from the main study (NCT04735406) will be used.
Participants in the control group will receive usual care practices during the clinical encounters.

study_pop.textblock: Participants from United States with Multiple sclerosis (MS) will be included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants willing and able to provide written informed consent
- Participants with clinical diagnosis of Multiple Sclerosis (MS)
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

overall_official.affiliation: Merck Healthcare KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany, an affiliate of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany

link.description: US Medical Information website, Medical Resources
